line_text: Hung be the heavens with black, yield day to night!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Comets, importing change of times and states,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brandish your crystal tresses in the sky,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And with them scourge the bad revolting stars
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That have consented unto Henry's death!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: King Henry the Fifth, too famous to live long!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: England ne'er lost a king of so much worth.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: England ne'er had a king until his time.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Virtue he had, deserving to command:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His brandish'd sword did blind men with his beams:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His arms spread wider than a dragon's wings;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His sparking eyes, replete with wrathful fire,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More dazzled and drove back his enemies
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than mid-day sun fierce bent against their faces.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What should I say? his deeds exceed all speech:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He ne'er lift up his hand but conquered.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We mourn in black: why mourn we not in blood?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry is dead and never shall revive:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Upon a wooden coffin we attend,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And death's dishonourable victory
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We with our stately presence glorify,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Like captives bound to a triumphant car.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What! shall we curse the planets of mishap
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That plotted thus our glory's overthrow?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or shall we think the subtle-witted French
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Conjurers and sorcerers, that afraid of him
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By magic verses have contrived his end?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He was a king bless'd of the King of kings.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unto the French the dreadful judgement-day
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So dreadful will not be as was his sight.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The battles of the Lord of hosts he fought:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The church's prayers made him so prosperous.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The church! where is it? Had not churchmen pray'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His thread of life had not so soon decay'd:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: None do you like but an effeminate prince,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom, like a school-boy, you may over-awe.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gloucester, whate'er we like, thou art protector
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And lookest to command the prince and realm.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy wife is proud; she holdeth thee in awe,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More than God or religious churchmen may.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Name not religion, for thou lovest the flesh,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And ne'er throughout the year to church thou go'st
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Except it be to pray against thy foes.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cease, cease these jars and rest your minds in peace:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let's to the altar: heralds, wait on us:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Instead of gold, we'll offer up our arms:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since arms avail not now that Henry's dead.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Posterity, await for wretched years,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When at their mothers' moist eyes babes shall suck,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our isle be made a nourish of salt tears,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And none but women left to wail the dead.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Prosper this realm, keep it from civil broils,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Combat with adverse planets in the heavens!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A far more glorious star thy soul will make
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than Julius Caesar or bright--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My honourable lords, health to you all!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sad tidings bring I to you out of France,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of loss, of slaughter and discomfiture:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Guienne, Champagne, Rheims, Orleans,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Paris, Guysors, Poictiers, are all quite lost.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What say'st thou, man, before dead Henry's corse?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak softly, or the loss of those great towns
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will make him burst his lead and rise from death.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is Paris lost? is Rouen yielded up?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If Henry were recall'd to life again,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These news would cause him once more yield the ghost.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How were they lost? what treachery was used?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No treachery; but want of men and money.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Amongst the soldiers this is muttered,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That here you maintain several factions,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And whilst a field should be dispatch'd and fought,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You are disputing of your generals:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: One would have lingering wars with little cost;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Another would fly swift, but wanteth wings;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A third thinks, without expense at all,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By guileful fair words peace may be obtain'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Awake, awake, English nobility!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let not sloth dim your horrors new-begot:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cropp'd are the flower-de-luces in your arms;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of England's coat one half is cut away.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Were our tears wanting to this funeral,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These tidings would call forth their flowing tides.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Me they concern; Regent I am of France.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Give me my steeled coat. I'll fight for France.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away with these disgraceful wailing robes!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wounds will I lend the French instead of eyes,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To weep their intermissive miseries.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lords, view these letters full of bad mischance.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: France is revolted from the English quite,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Except some petty towns of no import:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Dauphin Charles is crowned king of Rheims;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Bastard of Orleans with him is join'd;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Reignier, Duke of Anjou, doth take his part;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Duke of Alencon flieth to his side.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Dauphin crowned king! all fly to him!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, whither shall we fly from this reproach?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We will not fly, but to our enemies' throats.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bedford, if thou be slack, I'll fight it out.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An army have I muster'd in my thoughts,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wherewith already France is overrun.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My gracious lords, to add to your laments,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wherewith you now bedew King Henry's hearse,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I must inform you of a dismal fight
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Betwixt the stout Lord Talbot and the French.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What! wherein Talbot overcame? is't so?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, no; wherein Lord Talbot was o'erthrown:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The circumstance I'll tell you more at large.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The tenth of August last this dreadful lord,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Retiring from the siege of Orleans,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Having full scarce six thousand in his troop.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By three and twenty thousand of the French
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was round encompassed and set upon.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No leisure had he to enrank his men;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He wanted pikes to set before his archers;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Instead whereof sharp stakes pluck'd out of hedges
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They pitched in the ground confusedly,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To keep the horsemen off from breaking in.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More than three hours the fight continued;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where valiant Talbot above human thought
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Enacted wonders with his sword and lance:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hundreds he sent to hell, and none durst stand him;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here, there, and every where, enraged he flew:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The French exclaim'd, the devil was in arms;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: All the whole army stood agazed on him:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His soldiers spying his undaunted spirit
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A Talbot! a Talbot! cried out amain
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And rush'd into the bowels of the battle.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here had the conquest fully been seal'd up,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If Sir John Fastolfe had not play'd the coward:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He, being in the vaward, placed behind
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With purpose to relieve and follow them,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cowardly fled, not having struck one stroke.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hence grew the general wreck and massacre;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Enclosed were they with their enemies:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A base Walloon, to win the Dauphin's grace,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thrust Talbot with a spear into the back,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom all France with their chief assembled strength
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Durst not presume to look once in the face.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is Talbot slain? then I will slay myself,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For living idly here in pomp and ease,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whilst such a worthy leader, wanting aid,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unto his dastard foemen is betray'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O no, he lives; but is took prisoner,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Lord Scales with him and Lord Hungerford:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Most of the rest slaughter'd or took likewise.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His ransom there is none but I shall pay:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll hale the Dauphin headlong from his throne:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His crown shall be the ransom of my friend;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Four of their lords I'll change for one of ours.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, my masters; to my task will I;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bonfires in France forthwith I am to make,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To keep our great Saint George's feast withal:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ten thousand soldiers with me I will take,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose bloody deeds shall make all Europe quake.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So you had need; for Orleans is besieged;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The English army is grown weak and faint:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Earl of Salisbury craveth supply,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And hardly keeps his men from mutiny,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since they, so few, watch such a multitude.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Remember, lords, your oaths to Henry sworn,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Either to quell the Dauphin utterly,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or bring him in obedience to your yoke.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I do remember it; and here take my leave,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To go about my preparation.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll to the Tower with all the haste I can,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To view the artillery and munition;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And then I will proclaim young Henry king.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To Eltham will I, where the young king is,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Being ordain'd his special governor,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And for his safety there I'll best devise.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Each hath his place and function to attend:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am left out; for me nothing remains.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But long I will not be Jack out of office:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The king from Eltham I intend to steal
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And sit at chiefest stern of public weal.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mars his true moving, even as in the heavens
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So in the earth, to this day is not known:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Late did he shine upon the English side;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now we are victors; upon us he smiles.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What towns of any moment but we have?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At pleasure here we lie near Orleans;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Otherwhiles the famish'd English, like pale ghosts,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Faintly besiege us one hour in a month.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They want their porridge and their fat bull-beeves:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Either they must be dieted like mules
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And have their provender tied to their mouths
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or piteous they will look, like drowned mice.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let's raise the siege: why live we idly here?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Talbot is taken, whom we wont to fear:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Remaineth none but mad-brain'd Salisbury;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And he may well in fretting spend his gall,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor men nor money hath he to make war.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sound, sound alarum! we will rush on them.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now for the honour of the forlorn French!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Him I forgive my death that killeth me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When he sees me go back one foot or fly.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who ever saw the like? what men have I!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dogs! cowards! dastards! I would ne'er have fled,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that they left me 'midst my enemies.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Salisbury is a desperate homicide;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He fighteth as one weary of his life.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The other lords, like lions wanting food,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Do rush upon us as their hungry prey.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Froissart, a countryman of ours, records,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: England all Olivers and Rowlands bred,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: During the time Edward the Third did reign.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More truly now may this be verified;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For none but Samsons and Goliases
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It sendeth forth to skirmish. One to ten!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lean, raw-boned rascals! who would e'er suppose
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They had such courage and audacity?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let's leave this town; for they are hare-brain'd slaves,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And hunger will enforce them to be more eager:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of old I know them; rather with their teeth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The walls they'll tear down than forsake the siege.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I think, by some odd gimmors or device
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Their arms are set like clocks, stiff to strike on;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Else ne'er could they hold out so as they do.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By my consent, we'll even let them alone.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be it so.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where's the Prince Dauphin? I have news for him.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bastard of Orleans, thrice welcome to us.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methinks your looks are sad, your cheer appall'd:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath the late overthrow wrought this offence?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be not dismay'd, for succor is at hand:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A holy maid hither with me I bring,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which by a vision sent to her from heaven
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ordained is to raise this tedious siege
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And drive the English forth the bounds of France.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The spirit of deep prophecy she hath,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Exceeding the nine sibyls of old Rome:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What's past and what's to come she can descry.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak, shall I call her in? Believe my words,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For they are certain and unfallible.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go, call her in.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But first, to try her skill,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Reignier, stand thou as Dauphin in my place:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Question her proudly; let thy looks be stern:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By this means shall we sound what skill she hath.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fair maid, is't thou wilt do these wondrous feats?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Reignier, is't thou that thinkest to beguile me?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where is the Dauphin? Come, come from behind;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I know thee well, though never seen before.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be not amazed, there's nothing hid from me:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In private will I talk with thee apart.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stand back, you lords, and give us leave awhile.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She takes upon her bravely at first dash.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dauphin, I am by birth a shepherd's daughter,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My wit untrain'd in any kind of art.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Heaven and our Lady gracious hath it pleased
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To shine on my contemptible estate:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lo, whilst I waited on my tender lambs,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And to sun's parching heat display'd my cheeks,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: God's mother deigned to appear to me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in a vision full of majesty
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will'd me to leave my base vocation
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And free my country from calamity:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Her aid she promised and assured success:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In complete glory she reveal'd herself;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, whereas I was black and swart before,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With those clear rays which she infused on me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That beauty am I bless'd with which you see.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ask me what question thou canst possible,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I will answer unpremeditated:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My courage try by combat, if thou darest,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou shalt find that I exceed my sex.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Resolve on this, thou shalt be fortunate,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If thou receive me for thy warlike mate.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou hast astonish'd me with thy high terms:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Only this proof I'll of thy valour make,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In single combat thou shalt buckle with me,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And if thou vanquishest, thy words are true;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Otherwise I renounce all confidence.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am prepared: here is my keen-edged sword,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Deck'd with five flower-de-luces on each side;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The which at Touraine, in Saint Katharine's
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: churchyard,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Out of a great deal of old iron I chose forth.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then come, o' God's name; I fear no woman.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And while I live, I'll ne'er fly from a man.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stay, stay thy hands! thou art an Amazon
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And fightest with the sword of Deborah.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Christ's mother helps me, else I were too weak.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whoe'er helps thee, 'tis thou that must help me:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Impatiently I burn with thy desire;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My heart and hands thou hast at once subdued.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Excellent Pucelle, if thy name be so,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let me thy servant and not sovereign be:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis the French Dauphin sueth to thee thus.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I must not yield to any rites of love,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For my profession's sacred from above:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When I have chased all thy foes from hence,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then will I think upon a recompense.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Meantime look gracious on thy prostrate thrall.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, methinks, is very long in talk.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Doubtless he shrives this woman to her smock;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Else ne'er could he so long protract his speech.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall we disturb him, since he keeps no mean?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He may mean more than we poor men do know:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These women are shrewd tempters with their tongues.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, where are you? what devise you on?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall we give over Orleans, or no?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, no, I say, distrustful recreants!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fight till the last gasp; I will be your guard.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What she says I'll confirm: we'll fight it out.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Assign'd am I to be the English scourge.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This night the siege assuredly I'll raise:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Expect Saint Martin's summer, halcyon days,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since I have entered into these wars.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Glory is like a circle in the water,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which never ceaseth to enlarge itself
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till by broad spreading it disperse to nought.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With Henry's death the English circle ends;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dispersed are the glories it included.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now am I like that proud insulting ship
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which Caesar and his fortune bare at once.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was Mahomet inspired with a dove?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou with an eagle art inspired then.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Helen, the mother of great Constantine,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor yet Saint Philip's daughters, were like thee.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bright star of Venus, fall'n down on the earth,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How may I reverently worship thee enough?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Leave off delays, and let us raise the siege.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Woman, do what thou canst to save our honours;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Drive them from Orleans and be immortalized.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Presently we'll try: come, let's away about it:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No prophet will I trust, if she prove false.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am come to survey the Tower this day:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Since Henry's death, I fear, there is conveyance.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Where be these warders, that they wait not here?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Open the gates; 'tis Gloucester that calls.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: It is the noble Duke of Gloucester.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Villains, answer you so the lord protector?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: We do no otherwise than we are will'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Who willed you? or whose will stands but mine?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: There's none protector of the realm but I.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Break up the gates, I'll be your warrantize.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Shall I be flouted thus by dunghill grooms?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: What noise is this? what traitors have we here?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Lieutenant, is it you whose voice I hear?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Open the gates; here's Gloucester that would enter.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Have patience, noble duke; I may not open;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: The Cardinal of Winchester forbids:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: From him I have express commandment
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: That thou nor none of thine shall be let in.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Faint-hearted Woodvile, prizest him 'fore me?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Arrogant Winchester, that haughty prelate,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Whom Henry, our late sovereign, ne'er could brook?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thou art no friend to God or to the king:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Open the gates, or I'll shut thee out shortly.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Open the gates unto the lord protector,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Or we'll burst them open, if that you come not quickly.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: How now, ambitious Humphry! what means this?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Peel'd priest, dost thou command me to be shut out?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I do, thou most usurping proditor,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: And not protector, of the king or realm.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Stand back, thou manifest conspirator,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thou that contrivedst to murder our dead lord;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thou that givest whores indulgences to sin:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I'll canvass thee in thy broad cardinal's hat,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: If thou proceed in this thy insolence.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Nay, stand thou back, I will not budge a foot:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: This be Damascus, be thou cursed Cain,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: To slay thy brother Abel, if thou wilt.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I will not slay thee, but I'll drive thee back:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thy scarlet robes as a child's bearing-cloth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I'll use to carry thee out of this place.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Do what thou darest; I beard thee to thy face.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: What! am I dared and bearded to my face?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Draw, men, for all this privileged place;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Blue coats to tawny coats. Priest, beware your beard,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I mean to tug it and to cuff you soundly:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Under my feet I stamp thy cardinal's hat:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: In spite of pope or dignities of church,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Here by the cheeks I'll drag thee up and down.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Gloucester, thou wilt answer this before the pope.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Winchester goose, I cry, a rope! a rope!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thee I'll chase hence, thou wolf in sheep's array.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Out, tawny coats! out, scarlet hypocrite!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Fie, lords! that you, being supreme magistrates,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thus contumeliously should break the peace!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Peace, mayor! thou know'st little of my wrongs:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Here's Beaufort, that regards nor God nor king,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Hath here distrain'd the Tower to his use.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Here's Gloucester, a foe to citizens,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: One that still motions war and never peace,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: O'ercharging your free purses with large fines,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: That seeks to overthrow religion,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Because he is protector of the realm,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: And would have armour here out of the Tower,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: To crown himself king and suppress the prince.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I will not answer thee with words, but blows.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Naught rests for me in this tumultuous strife
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: But to make open proclamation:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Come, officer; as loud as e'er thou canst,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Cry.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: All manner of men assembled here in arms this day
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: against God's peace and the king's, we charge and
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: command you, in his highness' name, to repair to
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: your several dwelling-places; and not to wear,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: handle, or use any sword, weapon, or dagger,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: henceforward, upon pain of death.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Cardinal, I'll be no breaker of the law:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: But we shall meet, and break our minds at large.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Gloucester, we will meet; to thy cost, be sure:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Thy heart-blood I will have for this day's work.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I'll call for clubs, if you will not away.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: This cardinal's more haughty than the devil.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Mayor, farewell: thou dost but what thou mayst.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Abominable Gloucester, guard thy head;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: For I intend to have it ere long.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: See the coast clear'd, and then we will depart.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Good God, these nobles should such stomachs bear!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: I myself fight not once in forty year.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.

line_text: Sirrah, thou know'st how Orleans is besieged,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And how the English have the suburbs won.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father, I know; and oft have shot at them,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Howe'er unfortunate I miss'd my aim.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But now thou shalt not. Be thou ruled by me:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Chief master-gunner am I of this town;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Something I must do to procure me grace.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The prince's espials have informed me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How the English, in the suburbs close intrench'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wont, through a secret grate of iron bars
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In yonder tower, to overpeer the city,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thence discover how with most advantage
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They may vex us with shot, or with assault.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To intercept this inconvenience,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A piece of ordnance 'gainst it I have placed;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And even these three days have I watch'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If I could see them.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now do thou watch, for I can stay no longer.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If thou spy'st any, run and bring me word;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou shalt find me at the governor's.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father, I warrant you; take you no care;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll never trouble you, if I may spy them.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Talbot, my life, my joy, again return'd!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How wert thou handled being prisoner?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or by what means got'st thou to be released?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Discourse, I prithee, on this turret's top.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Duke of Bedford had a prisoner
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Call'd the brave Lord Ponton de Santrailles;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For him was I exchanged and ransomed.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But with a baser man of arms by far
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Once in contempt they would have barter'd me:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which I, disdaining, scorn'd; and craved death,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Rather than I would be so vile esteem'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In fine, redeem'd I was as I desired.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, O! the treacherous Fastolfe wounds my heart,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom with my bare fists I would execute,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If I now had him brought into my power.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet tell'st thou not how thou wert entertain'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With scoffs and scorns and contumelious taunts.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In open market-place produced they me,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To be a public spectacle to all:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here, said they, is the terror of the French,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The scarecrow that affrights our children so.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then broke I from the officers that led me,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And with my nails digg'd stones out of the ground,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To hurl at the beholders of my shame:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My grisly countenance made others fly;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: None durst come near for fear of sudden death.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In iron walls they deem'd me not secure;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So great fear of my name 'mongst them was spread,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That they supposed I could rend bars of steel,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And spurn in pieces posts of adamant:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wherefore a guard of chosen shot I had,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That walked about me every minute-while;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And if I did but stir out of my bed,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ready they were to shoot me to the heart.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I grieve to hear what torments you endured,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But we will be revenged sufficiently
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now it is supper-time in Orleans:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here, through this grate, I count each one
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: and view the Frenchmen how they fortify:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let us look in; the sight will much delight thee.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sir Thomas Gargrave, and Sir William Glansdale,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let me have your express opinions
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where is best place to make our battery next.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I think, at the north gate; for there stand lords.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I, here, at the bulwark of the bridge.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For aught I see, this city must be famish'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or with light skirmishes enfeebled.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O Lord, have mercy on us, wretched sinners!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O Lord, have mercy on me, woful man!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak, Salisbury; at least, if thou canst speak:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How farest thou, mirror of all martial men?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: One of thy eyes and thy cheek's side struck off!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Accursed tower! accursed fatal hand
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That hath contrived this woful tragedy!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In thirteen battles Salisbury o'ercame;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry the Fifth he first train'd to the wars;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whilst any trump did sound, or drum struck up,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His sword did ne'er leave striking in the field.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet livest thou, Salisbury? though thy speech doth fail,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: One eye thou hast, to look to heaven for grace:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The sun with one eye vieweth all the world.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Heaven, be thou gracious to none alive,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If Salisbury wants mercy at thy hands!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bear hence his body; I will help to bury it.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sir Thomas Gargrave, hast thou any life?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak unto Talbot; nay, look up to him.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Salisbury, cheer thy spirit with this comfort;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou shalt not die whiles--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He beckons with his hand and smiles on me.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As who should say 'When I am dead and gone,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Remember to avenge me on the French.'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Plantagenet, I will; and like thee, Nero,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Play on the lute, beholding the towns burn:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wretched shall France be only in my name.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What stir is this? what tumult's in the heavens?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whence cometh this alarum and the noise?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, my lord, the French have gathered head:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Dauphin, with one Joan la Pucelle join'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A holy prophetess new risen up,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is come with a great power to raise the siege.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It irks his heart he cannot be revenged.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Frenchmen, I'll be a Salisbury to you:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pucelle or puzzel, dolphin or dogfish,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your hearts I'll stamp out with my horse's heels,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And make a quagmire of your mingled brains.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Convey me Salisbury into his tent,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And then we'll try what these dastard Frenchmen dare.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where is my strength, my valour, and my force?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our English troops retire, I cannot stay them:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A woman clad in armour chaseth them.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here, here she comes. I'll have a bout with thee;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Devil or devil's dam, I'll conjure thee:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Blood will I draw on thee, thou art a witch,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And straightway give thy soul to him thou servest.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, come, 'tis only I that must disgrace thee.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Heavens, can you suffer hell so to prevail?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My breast I'll burst with straining of my courage
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And from my shoulders crack my arms asunder.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But I will chastise this high-minded strumpet.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Talbot, farewell; thy hour is not yet come:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I must go victual Orleans forthwith.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O'ertake me, if thou canst; I scorn thy strength.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go, go, cheer up thy hungry-starved men;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Help Salisbury to make his testament:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This day is ours, as many more shall be.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I know not where I am, nor what I do;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A witch, by fear, not force, like Hannibal,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Drives back our troops and conquers as she lists:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So bees with smoke and doves with noisome stench
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are from their hives and houses driven away.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They call'd us for our fierceness English dogs;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, like to whelps, we crying run away.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hark, countrymen! either renew the fight,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or tear the lions out of England's coat;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Renounce your soil, give sheep in lions' stead:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sheep run not half so treacherous from the wolf,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or horse or oxen from the leopard,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As you fly from your oft-subdued slaves.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It will not be: retire into your trenches:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You all consented unto Salisbury's death,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For none would strike a stroke in his revenge.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pucelle is enter'd into Orleans,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In spite of us or aught that we could do.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, would I were to die with Salisbury!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The shame hereof will make me hide my head.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Advance our waving colours on the walls;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Rescued is Orleans from the English
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus Joan la Pucelle hath perform'd her word.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Divinest creature, Astraea's daughter,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How shall I honour thee for this success?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy promises are like Adonis' gardens
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That one day bloom'd and fruitful were the next.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: France, triumph in thy glorious prophetess!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Recover'd is the town of Orleans:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More blessed hap did ne'er befall our state.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why ring not out the bells aloud throughout the town?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dauphin, command the citizens make bonfires
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And feast and banquet in the open streets,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To celebrate the joy that God hath given us.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: All France will be replete with mirth and joy,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When they shall hear how we have play'd the men.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis Joan, not we, by whom the day is won;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For which I will divide my crown with her,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all the priests and friars in my realm
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall in procession sing her endless praise.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A statelier pyramis to her I'll rear
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than Rhodope's or Memphis' ever was:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In memory of her when she is dead,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Her ashes, in an urn more precious
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than the rich-jewel'd of Darius,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Transported shall be at high festivals
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before the kings and queens of France.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No longer on Saint Denis will we cry,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But Joan la Pucelle shall be France's saint.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come in, and let us banquet royally,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: After this golden day of victory.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sirs, take your places and be vigilant:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If any noise or soldier you perceive
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Near to the walls, by some apparent sign
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let us have knowledge at the court of guard.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sergeant, you shall.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus are poor servitors,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When others sleep upon their quiet beds,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Constrain'd to watch in darkness, rain and cold.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord Regent, and redoubted Burgundy,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By whose approach the regions of Artois,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wallon and Picardy are friends to us,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This happy night the Frenchmen are secure,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Having all day caroused and banqueted:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Embrace we then this opportunity
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As fitting best to quittance their deceit
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Contrived by art and baleful sorcery.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Coward of France! how much he wrongs his fame,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Despairing of his own arm's fortitude,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To join with witches and the help of hell!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Traitors have never other company.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But what's that Pucelle whom they term so pure?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A maid, they say.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A maid! and be so martial!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pray God she prove not masculine ere long,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If underneath the standard of the French
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She carry armour as she hath begun.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well, let them practise and converse with spirits:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: God is our fortress, in whose conquering name
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let us resolve to scale their flinty bulwarks.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ascend, brave Talbot; we will follow thee.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not all together: better far, I guess,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That we do make our entrance several ways;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That, if it chance the one of us do fail,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The other yet may rise against their force.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Agreed: I'll to yond corner.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I to this.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And here will Talbot mount, or make his grave.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, Salisbury, for thee, and for the right
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of English Henry, shall this night appear
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How much in duty I am bound to both.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Arm! arm! the enemy doth make assault!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How now, my lords! what, all unready so?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unready! ay, and glad we 'scaped so well.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas time, I trow, to wake and leave our beds,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hearing alarums at our chamber-doors.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of all exploits since first I follow'd arms,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ne'er heard I of a warlike enterprise
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More venturous or desperate than this.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I think this Talbot be a fiend of hell.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If not of hell, the heavens, sure, favour him.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here cometh Charles: I marvel how he sped.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tut, holy Joan was his defensive guard.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is this thy cunning, thou deceitful dame?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Didst thou at first, to flatter us withal,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Make us partakers of a little gain,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That now our loss might be ten times so much?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wherefore is Charles impatient with his friend!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At all times will you have my power alike?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sleeping or waking must I still prevail,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or will you blame and lay the fault on me?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Improvident soldiers! had your watch been good,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This sudden mischief never could have fall'n.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Duke of Alencon, this was your default,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That, being captain of the watch to-night,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Did look no better to that weighty charge.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Had all your quarters been as safely kept
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As that whereof I had the government,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We had not been thus shamefully surprised.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mine was secure.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And so was mine, my lord.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, for myself, most part of all this night,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Within her quarter and mine own precinct
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I was employ'd in passing to and fro,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: About relieving of the sentinels:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then how or which way should they first break in?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Question, my lords, no further of the case,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How or which way: 'tis sure they found some place
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But weakly guarded, where the breach was made.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now there rests no other shift but this;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To gather our soldiers, scatter'd and dispersed,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And lay new platforms to endamage them.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll be so bold to take what they have left.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The cry of Talbot serves me for a sword;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I have loaden me with many spoils,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Using no other weapon but his name.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The day begins to break, and night is fled,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Whose pitchy mantle over-veil'd the earth.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Here sound retreat, and cease our hot pursuit.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Bring forth the body of old Salisbury,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: And here advance it in the market-place,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: The middle centre of this cursed town.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Now have I paid my vow unto his soul;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: For every drop of blood was drawn from him,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: There hath at least five Frenchmen died tonight.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: And that hereafter ages may behold
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: What ruin happen'd in revenge of him,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Within their chiefest temple I'll erect
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: A tomb, wherein his corpse shall be interr'd:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Upon the which, that every one may read,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Shall be engraved the sack of Orleans,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: The treacherous manner of his mournful death
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: And what a terror he had been to France.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: But, lords, in all our bloody massacre,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: I muse we met not with the Dauphin's grace,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: His new-come champion, virtuous Joan of Arc,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.

line_text: Nor any of his false confederates.
